Merge pull request #279 from fkling/patch-1

async/await is not part of ES7

async/await is not part of ES7

I assume ES7 is a synonym for ES2016 here. ES2016 was just released and async/await is not a part of it. I believe keeping this expression will confuse people who don't really follow the standard process.

Expose the underlying generator function from wrapper functions

Currently it's impossible to inspect the wrapped generator function if you want
to dynamically extract its source to produce documentation. With native async
functions this won't be a problem but right now the `co.wrap` wrapper is too
opaque for this use case.

Merge pull request #23 from alexmingoia/master

Preserve context when using `co.wrap()`

Preserve context when using `co.wrap()`

When wrapping prototype/instance methods, you don't have the context available to pass to `co.wrap()`. This commit defaults the context to the caller of the method being wrapped, instead of the thunk returned.
